mutants.code:
def is_kth_bit_set(n: int, k: int) -> bool:
    """
    Check if the k-th bit of the number n is set (i.e., 1).

    Parameters:
    - n (int): The number whose bits are to be checked.
    - k (int): The bit position (0-indexed) from the LSB to check.

    Returns:
    - bool: True if the k-th bit is set, False otherwise.
    """
    return n >> k & 1 != 1

def is_kth_bit_set(n: int, k: int) -> bool:
    """
    Check if the k-th bit of the number n is set (i.e., 1).

    Parameters:
    - n (int): The number whose bits are to be checked.
    - k (int): The bit position (0-indexed) from the LSB to check.

    Returns:
    - bool: True if the k-th bit is set, False otherwise.
    """
    return n >> k | 1 == 1

def is_kth_bit_set(n: int, k: int) -> bool:
    """
    Check if the k-th bit of the number n is set (i.e., 1).

    Parameters:
    - n (int): The number whose bits are to be checked.
    - k (int): The bit position (0-indexed) from the LSB to check.

    Returns:
    - bool: True if the k-th bit is set, False otherwise.
    """
    return n >> k & 1 == 2

def is_kth_bit_set(n: int, k: int) -> bool:
    """
    Check if the k-th bit of the number n is set (i.e., 1).

    Parameters:
    - n (int): The number whose bits are to be checked.
    - k (int): The bit position (0-indexed) from the LSB to check.

    Returns:
    - bool: True if the k-th bit is set, False otherwise.
    """
    return n >> k & 1 == 0

def is_kth_bit_set(n: int, k: int) -> bool:
    """
    Check if the k-th bit of the number n is set (i.e., 1).

    Parameters:
    - n (int): The number whose bits are to be checked.
    - k (int): The bit position (0-indexed) from the LSB to check.

    Returns:
    - bool: True if the k-th bit is set, False otherwise.
    """
    return n >> k & 1 == 0

def is_kth_bit_set(n: int, k: int) -> bool:
    """
    Check if the k-th bit of the number n is set (i.e., 1).

    Parameters:
    - n (int): The number whose bits are to be checked.
    - k (int): The bit position (0-indexed) from the LSB to check.

    Returns:
    - bool: True if the k-th bit is set, False otherwise.
    """
    return n >> k & 1 == -1

def is_kth_bit_set(n: int, k: int) -> bool:
    """
    Check if the k-th bit of the number n is set (i.e., 1).

    Parameters:
    - n (int): The number whose bits are to be checked.
    - k (int): The bit position (0-indexed) from the LSB to check.

    Returns:
    - bool: True if the k-th bit is set, False otherwise.
    """
    return n >> k & 2 == 1

def is_kth_bit_set(n: int, k: int) -> bool:
    """
    Check if the k-th bit of the number n is set (i.e., 1).

    Parameters:
    - n (int): The number whose bits are to be checked.
    - k (int): The bit position (0-indexed) from the LSB to check.

    Returns:
    - bool: True if the k-th bit is set, False otherwise.
    """
    return n >> k & 0 == 1

def is_kth_bit_set(n: int, k: int) -> bool:
    """
    Check if the k-th bit of the number n is set (i.e., 1).

    Parameters:
    - n (int): The number whose bits are to be checked.
    - k (int): The bit position (0-indexed) from the LSB to check.

    Returns:
    - bool: True if the k-th bit is set, False otherwise.
    """
    return n >> k & 0 == 1

def is_kth_bit_set(n: int, k: int) -> bool:
    """
    Check if the k-th bit of the number n is set (i.e., 1).

    Parameters:
    - n (int): The number whose bits are to be checked.
    - k (int): The bit position (0-indexed) from the LSB to check.

    Returns:
    - bool: True if the k-th bit is set, False otherwise.
    """
    return n >> k & -1 == 1
